intro: Malvastrum pichinchense, commonly known as the Pichincha mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red, often with a white center. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly encountered in the wild.
